Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: One City Center is located in the heart of Downtown Durham on a historic site bounded by W. Main, N. Corcoran and W. Parrish Streets. The property is surrounded by successful adaptive reuse and development projects such as the American Tobacco Historic District, West Village, the Durham Performing Arts Center and the Durham Bulls Athletic Park, to name a few. It is also at the epicenter of ongoing and planned development projects, including the 21c Museum Hotel, Aloft Hotel, Unscripted Hotel, Hotel Durham, and five apartment communities totaling more than 1,100 new units.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Iconic Mixed-Use Development in the Heart of Downtown Durham

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Energetic outdoor areas lining over 1,000,000 SF of office and retail space with convenient on-site parking
Designated on-site free parking
Over 3,000 residential units in Downtown Durham
Over 4,000 employees within American Tobacco Campus
Over 1.3 million visitors each year from around the globe

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: American Tobacco Campus is a 40-acre mixed-use campus featuring Durham Performing Arts Center (one of the top three most attended theaters in the world with more than 200 events a year) and Durham Bulls Athletic Park (with more than 80 games/events a year). Easily accessible from Durham Freeway, the campus sits in the heart of Durham's restaurant and brewery experience.

Nestled among the hip, urban neighborhoods of the West Village, Brightleaf Square, and DIY District, Durham.ID is where innovation makes its home downtown. The 15-acre research hub and live-work-play campus connects dynamic neighborhoods on the west side of Downtown Durham. Two newly built Class-A office buildings, located at 200 & 300 Morris Street, create a Southern Gateway to Durham.ID. The buildings include over 12,000 SF of ground floor retail space, a rooftop restaurant and 1,200+ car parking garage.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Ground Floor Retail Space Available in Downtown Durham's Innovation District

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: 1,550 SF and 3,600 SF ground floor retail space available
High visibility and frontage on W. Chapel Hill St. and S. Duke St.
Immediate access to NC-147
Walkscore: 90
On-site parking

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Mutual Tower is the most iconic office building in Durham, standing 14 stories tall and 180,402 SF with a history as rich as Durham itself. With approximately $13 million of recent and pending capital improvements and new ownership under
Turnbridge Equities, Mutual Tower has positioned itself as an modern office environment with a highly-sought-after downtown Durham location without new construction market rates.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: The Most Storied and Recognizable Office Tower in Downtown Durham

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Full of energy and excitement, Brightleaf is an irresistibly authentic and inviting community fueled by its modern scholarly community and historic vibes. Located just steps from Downtown Durham, Brightleaf is in the heart of North Carolinas nternationally-known Research Triangle which encompasses Raleigh-Durham, Cary and Chapel Hill  collectively one of the fastest growing MSAs in the country.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Offering integrated retail and restaurant uses, Exchange on Erwin is a rare opportunity to lease in the Durhams General Education and Medical corridor. The property features direct access to the luxury Flats on Exchange apartment community (265 units), adjoining office, and Duke University Hospital (over 11,000 employees). Additionally, the Property is within walking distance to Duke University (14,600 students) and the VA Hospital (3,400 employees). Durham has experienced a renaissance of growth in the last five years, with no end in sight. A thriving community abounding with a well-educated and creative demographics, Durhams growth trajectory is continually positive.
